title: Pablo-wood
author: Pablo-wood
content: Many will say DCA is their strategy. This DCA strategy of a thing is only for those who  have huge capital or an amount that is sufficient for them to ignore and possibly has other sources of income in that the can choose to neglect what ever the market does and focus on their other stream of income.Now for an average investor, one who is hoping to take profit soon, I don't mean those who have enough to spare.  It's best we don't lead people into regrets and pains with our contributions. Not everyone can afford to buy at intervals. As we all can see for the past two to three months the market has not chosen a direction, it is neither buying or selling and some persons are waiting to take profit it price rises a little. So my question is judging by the range market we currently experience is it every dip and average Bitcoin investor should buy?

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: I disagree, DCA strategy is for people who don't have time, hence you don't have to check the price and just buy it.I agree average investors prefer to take profit soon over long term, hence not many people can use DCA strategy because you need to completely trust the asset and discipline, most people aren't discipline enough.My speculation Bitcoin price will rise higher than $109K in this year, since the price now hovering around $84K, so Bitcoin is quite cheaper now.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Pablo-wood on March 15, 2025, 12:10:47 PMMany will say DCA is their strategy. This DCA strategy of a thing is only for those who  have huge capital or an amount that is sufficient for them to ignore and possibly has other sources of income in that the can choose to neglect what ever the market does and focus on their other stream of income.Do not get it wrong. You can have just one job and be using 10 to 30% of your income to buy bitcoin every week or every time the price dip a little which occurs often. You do not need to have huge amount of money or multiple sources of income before you can DCA.Quote from: Pablo-wood on March 15, 2025, 12:10:47 PMNow for an average investor, one who is hoping to take profit soon, I don't mean those who have enough to spare.  It's best we don't lead people into regrets and pains with our contributions. Not everyone can afford to buy at intervals. People should cut her clothes according to their size. You need money to invest. That is how life is. Quote from: Pablo-wood on March 15, 2025, 12:10:47 PMAs we all can see for the past two to three months the market has not chosen a direction, it is neither buying or selling and some persons are waiting to take profit it price rises a little. So my question is judging by the range market we currently experience is it every dip and average Bitcoin investor should buy?As it is going to $78000, people are buying. It formed a double bottom recently which encourage people to buy more. Anyone that does not have money or enough money should not invest.

comments.author: Pablo-wood
comments.body: Quote from: Oshosondy on March 15, 2025, 12:49:19 PM.....Are you not seeing the cost of livelihood in the society? Take away 10% or 30% from someone earning $100 a month, from someone who has a family or who is pursuing a professional degree. DCA is a good strategy when the market has a direction for short investors. Long term investors can afford to invest anytime without worries all the do is keep buying.Quote from: Helena Yu on March 15, 2025, 12:37:28 PMI disagree, DCA strategy is for people who don't have time, hence you don't have to check the price and just buy it.My speculation Bitcoin price will rise higher than $109K in this year, since the price now hovering around $84K, so Bitcoin is quite cheaper now.Let me agree that DCA is for people who don't have time? Fine if you don't have time and the target is short term investment don't you think you will be forced to sell at a loss especially when the need for that money arises?This thing is similar to some running a regular business. For me I do oil paim production as well as coding. Now for oil palm we have seasons where the Market are always very cheap. We buy in bulk and towards the of the year towards dry season oil becomes scares and price hikes. Mind you the big players will buy irrespective of the season because their own target is five times six years interval before they start selling by then price should have tripped

comments.author: bitLeap
comments.body: The DCA strategy you mentioned is certainly an ideal DCA strategy, but do you have to wait for the ideal to materialize? Of course not because everyone can and may do the DCA strategy in their own way and version. Even if it only lasts for a minimum of 1 or 2 years. For me DCA in any way will always be a great step to be appreciated.On the other hand investors have their own targets to find profit points and they clearly always take the method that has been planned long ago because money turnover is their priority to survive in market.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: At first when making a post do not try to be compelling or trying to make your post looks like you are or trying to impose something or a specific thing into people, here is a community and anyone chooses what they Love to do whenever and however they wants it. You can only give your general overview or purpose how you see things over here.Then back to your questions: Sincerely I strongly disagree with you that DCA is meant for specific people or persons. Like I know, anyone out there can apply DCA provided they chooses to use the DCA approach it's best for them, and I may decide to use that approach if I didn't reveal to you about my holdings or my approach you wouldn't know.So do not think others didn't have other source of income or additional way to earn money and of course anyone can do whatever they love with their investments provided it's their money they can sell buy at any given time they wishes without you or me holding them back. What we can do is to only advise them on the steps to follow and nothing more than that.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: The rush to buy bitcoins every time the price drops reminds me of an abnormal fanaticism. I prefer calm investments, without asking myself whether I urgently need funds because the price seems attractive. The rule that you can’t earn all the money still exists, and I would like to remind everyone that people have other needs besides Bitcoin, and investing in it should not be a must, but something you decide to buy from time to time.

comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: Quote from: Pablo-wood on March 15, 2025, 12:10:47 PMMany will say DCA is their strategy. This DCA strategy of a thing is only for those who  have huge capital or an amount that is sufficient for them to ignore and possibly has other sources of income in that the can choose to neglect what ever the market does and focus on their other stream of income. I think you are mistaken. If you have huge capital, why don’t you just buy bitcoin all at once instead of doing DCA and potentially missing out on the best time to enter the market? People who might still be saving up but wants to buy bitcoin now are the ones who are implementing this strategy. Quote So my question is judging by the range market we currently experience is it every dip and average Bitcoin investor should buy?No one is forcing you to buy bitcoin at every dip but that would be ideal. And DCA is not just buying at intervals. It’s just accumulating bitcoin little by little until you achieve the maximum amount you want.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: Pablo-wood on March 15, 2025, 12:10:47 PMMany will say DCA is their strategy. This DCA strategy of a thing is only for those who  have huge capital or an amount that is sufficient for them to ignore and possibly has other sources of income in that the can choose to neglect what ever the market does and focus on their other stream of income.Another advantage of making use of this investment strategy is for those with the hope of holding for a long time, it best serves the long term investors, because they will end up not loosing after holding for some time, they also take advantage of buying more on the dip in other to increase their chances of profitability, they may not literally have to invest at once, but they can set a particular pattern or strategy of accumulating by buying the more at each market bear and then keep holding, then after the bear ended, they have more chances of making more profits as the market proceeds towards the bullish trend, all these are possible with them because they can wait while holding till that time comes for them to profit at the market pump.

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: Quote from: Pablo-wood on March 15, 2025, 01:07:42 PMLet me agree that DCA is for people who don't have time? Fine if you don't have time and the target is short term investment don't you think you will be forced to sell at a loss especially when the need for that money arises?Now my question, why you invest for long term purpose when you don't even have emergency funds? emergency funds is really important, example this one where you need money while your investment are in floating loss. QuoteThis thing is similar to some running a regular business. For me I do oil paim production as well as coding. Now for oil palm we have seasons where the Market are always very cheap. We buy in bulk and towards the of the year towards dry season oil becomes scares and price hikes. Mind you the big players will buy irrespective of the season because their own target is five times six years interval before they start selling by then price should have tripped Alright I understand. Now what's the correlation with this discussion? If you buy palm oil at cheap price in bulk and then sell it when the price hikes, you're using lump sum strategy and this can be applied to Bitcoin.In this strategy, you must have a lot of money to start, instead of DCA strategy where you don't have to buy in bulk.

comments.author: KiaKia
comments.body: DCA method is for people who can't read the chart or who don't have the time to learn how to read the chart. The best decision I've made so far since 2022 was buying Bitcoin at the bottom of 15k and 18k, I have a tool but it is all visible in everyone's chart, the difference is many people don't know how to look it up. I went all in at the bottom, where many people will say you can never time the bottom, I just followed what my chart was showing, it was not that hard but possible because of some trading tools I have. I don't advice beginners to accumulate at this period, even if I can't time the bottom I knew that in a bull market it is almost too late for buying dips, the best time to buy the dips is in a full bear season.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: I will say just yes. If you have "cash fiat" ready to invest the best strategy is to buy when you can (maybe not during ATH but this happens just few times). why? because you need to focus on a long term projection. with a limited supply that decrease each year (new coin mined). even less coin on exchanges...  if you look without speculation you can understand that during these years "we are still early". of course, going all in is not a solution. you must always have a clear schedule of your money management, even taken in account to hold during crazy dump

If you buy palm oil at cheap price in bulk and then sell it when the price hikes, you're using lump sum strategy and this can be applied to Bitcoin.In this strategy, you must have a lot of money to start, instead of DCA strategy where you don't have to buy in bulk.This is not just about buying this palm oil. It's not just about buying palm oil. The word calm investment triggered my receptors. You understand typically what investment is all about. The aim of every business person is to stay in profit as much as they can. And this means knowing when to pause and observe and also knowing when to take advantage of opportunities.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: Pablo-wood on March 15, 2025, 12:10:47 PMNow for an average investor, one who is hoping to take profit soon, I don't mean those who have enough to spare.  It's best we don't lead people into regrets and pains with our contributions. Not everyone can afford to buy at intervals.Well, to each what works for them. Everyone should've a strategy that they understand and can work with for maximum gain. No one should copy others without understanding the strategy they adopt. Otherwise, frustration from their inability to utilize such strategy will set in. With DCA, it gets to a point if the market continues to dip that it doesn't make sense embarking on it anymore. What I do in such a situation is to abstain from the market.QuoteSo my question is judging by the range market we currently experience is it every dip and average Bitcoin investor should buy?No, it's not every dip an average Bitcoin investor should buy. I know it would look tempting not to buy when dip emerges to beat the previous dip. This is where self discipline comes in. Do nothing.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: Quote from: Pablo-wood on March 15, 2025, 12:10:47 PMAs we all can see for the past two to three months the market has not chosen a direction, it is neither buying or selling and some persons are waiting to take profit it price rises a little. So my question is judging by the range market we currently experience is it every dip and average Bitcoin investor should buy?OP, what you need to understand is that it is not every time the dip market happens in the crypto market that an investor would have spare money to invest in Bitcoin. There will be times when the dip market happens, and there won't be an availability of funds in one's hands to spare at that time. The investor needs to wait till when they have funds at hand to spare. The funds at hand can come when the market has bounced back or fallen lower. It will then depend on them to choose what their next move would be. Buy Bitcoin at the price they met Bitcoin at, or wait a little longer for a dip fall

comments.author: Botnake
comments.body: DCA is not limited for what kind of investor you are. If you are rich or an average one, as long as you have sustainable flow of income that would make you capable to buy bitcoin regularly, then you are free to do DCA all you want. Buy in every dip or buy regardless of the price, that depends on the availability of your funds. However, if you are planning to maximize your purchase to increase your portfolio faster, I suggest you buy in every dip with an amount that you are comfortable to lose.

comments.author: Tungbulu
comments.body: Quote from: Pablo-wood on March 15, 2025, 12:10:47 PMMany will say DCA is their strategy. This DCA strategy of a thing is only for those who  have huge capital or an amount that is sufficient for them to ignore and possibly has other sources of income in that the can choose to neglect what ever the market does and focus on their other stream of income.First of all, this is a very flawed perception of what the DCA strategy stands for. DCA isn’t only for those who have huge capitals. while it’s true that DCA is for people who has other sources of income, even the average investors can also seize the opportunity to invest in Bitcoin using the DCA strategy, because it’s not about your financial status, but your decision not to attempt targeting he market, because like we already know, the market is super volatile and other strategies, including buying the DIP can be classified as attempting to time the market which can be sometimes misleading because you’d never know what the future of the market hold. What you feel is a DIP could turn out to be the highest price you’d see for the next few months and for one who is impatient, you could end up selling at a loss. So the same way you feel anyone (regardless of their financial status) can BUY the DIP, that’s exactly how it is for the DCA strategy, the only difference is that, the DCA strategy is way more safer that attempting to Time the market by waiting for a DIP before you make your move.

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: What you are asking is what a short term trader should ask not a long (or semi long) term investor. As a trader you'd want to analyze the trends and try to figure out whether the dip is going to continue further or it has reached the bottom. Which is the answer to your question. Not every dip is worth buying.But when you are an investor, specially someone who doesn't want to spend a lot of time analyzing the market and doing trades, then DCA is the way to go. And no it doesn't need a lot of capital. In this scenario, even though the investor hopes for better opportunities and buying at the bottom but dips are generally considered all good opportunities.

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: Pablo-wood on March 15, 2025, 12:10:47 PMMany will say DCA is their strategy. This DCA strategy of a thing is only for those who  have huge capital or an amount that is sufficient for them to ignore and possibly has other sources of income in that the can choose to neglect what ever the market does and focus on their other stream of income.Buying Bitcoin is an investment and not just a means of saving money. DCA can be adopted both by low and high income earners, the difference will be the amount that is used to buy. Someone can decide to set aside $50, while another can afford to DCA $1000 monthly.QuoteNow for an average investor, one who is hoping to take profit soon, I don't mean those who have enough to spare.  It's best we don't lead people into regrets and pains with our contributions. Not everyone can afford to buy at intervals. I wouldn't advise anybody who wants to make an instant profit to buy Bitcoin because it should be a long-term investment. Trading Bitcoin and other coins are technical, which is why traders should understand that market and trading strategies. QuoteAs we all can see for the past two to three months the market has not chosen a direction, it is neither buying or selling and some persons are waiting to take profit it price rises a little. So my question is judging by the range market we currently experience is it every dip and average Bitcoin investor should buy?If you are a long term investor, it is okay to buy Bitcoin at anytime. But as a trader, it is important to always monitor the market before buying.

This DCA strategy of a thing is only for those who  have huge capital or an amount that is sufficient for them to ignore and possibly has other sources of income in that the can choose to neglect what ever the market does and focus on their other stream of income.I don't think so. One of the ways of this method is buying bitcoin bit by by which can be any amount,  the success of this method depends in consistency. You can only make good success from this method of investing if you are consistent.  Many find it difficult to invest in bitcoin because they don't have buck money but it easy to invest with DCA method with the little you can afford.
